intro: Maba smeathmannii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and simple, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in treating various ailments.
